oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pharmaceutical Services in Veterinary Teaching Institutions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Roy-Vezeau, Huguette
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: pharmaceutical services
veterinary teaching institution
clinics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In veterinary medicine, it is a time of growth and expansion. Veterinary teaching institutions are struggling to give their clinics a hospital profile and organization. The objective is to improve the clinical setting for students training and to improve the quality of services provided to animals and their owners. Providing pharmaceutical services is relatively new in veterinary institutions. The distribution and control of drugs and medical supplies by a pharmacist is becoming more and more important as the number and complexity of drugs dispensed increase and as the cost containment era with its mandatory reductions worsens. The objective of this paper is to outline the pharmaceutical services provided in veterinary teaching institutions for the last fiscal year of year ending December 31, 1981.
